instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 - quarter fan
threads.message:
Hello friends,

The plate has a quarter fan, with no signs of corrosion.

She is entering S0, 3v3_sus with 3.3, ALL_SYS_PWRGD 3.3v

any suggestion?

threads.title: 820-3332 - quarter fan
threads.message:
Any history available?
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: 820-3332 - quarter fan
threads.message:
No history! It was reported that it simply stopped.

Had already tried SMC bypass mode, it didn't work!

threads.title: 820-3332 - quarter fan
threads.message: ALL_SYS_PWRGD stays high, or only pulses?

threads.title: 820-3332 - quarter fan
threads.message: when cooler stops, it goes to 0v and back to 3.3

threads.title: 820-3332 - quarter fan
threads.message:
So power cycling.
CPU core appears then?

threads.title: 820-3332 - quarter fan
threads.message:
Lift one side all graphics coils and check if board stays on then.
I talk about L8930/60 and L8310/60...

threads.title: 820-3332 - quarter fan
threads.message: Try disabling GPU, just in case...

threads.title: 820-3332 - quarter fan
threads.message:
Perfect, I'll try.
I had already read a suggestion from you about it. I'll look up the procedure on the forum.
